title: 107_s2449
content: The Act titled "Federal Responsibility for Immigrant Health Act of 2002" allows federal payments under Medicaid for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens. The Act allows federal Medicaid payments for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens, including necessary care for emergencies, pregnancy-related services, and communicable disease testing and treatment. States have the option to waive residency requirements for aliens granted parole or admitted as nonimmigrant aliens. The Act allows federal Medicaid payments for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens, including necessary care for emergencies, pregnancy-related services, and communicable disease testing and treatment. States may waive residency requirements for nonimmigrant aliens under certain conditions. The amendments made by this section will apply to medical assistance provided after the enactment of this Act. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens is addressed in Section 3 of the Act. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens is addressed in Section 3 of the Act. Section 4723 of the Balanced Budget Act of 1997 is amended to allocate $25,000,000 for fiscal years 1998 through 2001 and $50,000,000 for fiscal years 2003 through 2007 to certain States. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will compute an additional allotment for the 15 States with the highest percentage of undocumented aliens for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. The Act allocates funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens. States will receive an allotment based on the percentage of undocumented aliens in the state, determined by the Immigration and Naturalization Service. Any unspent allotment in a fiscal year will be available for the following year. The Act allocates funding for emergency health services to undocumented aliens based on the percentage of undocumented aliens in each state. States must submit a plan to receive funds, which will be paid to hospitals and providers in areas impacted by health costs related to undocumented aliens. The Act provides funding for emergency medical services for undocumented aliens based on the volume of services provided by eligible hospitals and related providers. Definitions and special rules apply, including the meaning of "hospital" and "provider." Amounts paid under this subsection are specified. The Act provides funding for emergency medical services for undocumented aliens based on service volume. Amounts paid under this subsection are not to replace federal payments to states for emergency medical services under title XIX of the Social Security Act. The amendments made by this section apply from fiscal year 2003. SEC. 4. Permitting states and localities to provide health care to all individuals. The Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to exclude health benefits provided by state or local governments from the definition of assistance. The amendments made by the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 exclude health benefits provided by state or local governments from the definition of assistance. Effective immediately, these amendments apply to health care furnished before, on, or after the enactment of this Act.
